text: Richard Herman Driehaus (; July, 28 1942 â€“ March 9, 2021) was an American fund manager, businessman and philanthropist. He was the founder, chief investment officer, and chairman of Driehaus Capital Management LLC, based in Chicago. He was born in Chicago. He donated money to DePaul University and they named their business school after him.
